data.title: Remembering Queen Elizabeth II With 8 Inspiring TV Shows and Films
data.meta_description: Throughout her historic reign, many movies and series were made documenting the life of Queen Elizabeth II, who died aged 96 on September 8.
data.text:
Following the news of Queen Elizabeth II's death aged 96, many will be looking to remember and pay tribute to Britain's longest-reigning monarch.

Buckingham Palace confirmed the news of her passing on September 8, saying in a statement that she "died peacefully at Balmoral."

Queen Elizabeth II's death comes just 17 months after her husband Prince Philip passed away on April 9, 2021.

Throughout her historic reign, many movies and series have been made documenting Queen Elizabeth II's inspiring life.

From documentaries to Hollywood blockbusters, Newsweek has compiled a list of inspiring movies and TV shows to celebrate the life of Queen Elizabeth II.

Movies and TV Shows About Queen Elizabeth II

The Queen (2006)

With Helen Mirren in the titular role as Elizabeth II, this film follows the royal family in the immediate aftermath of Princess Diana's death in 1997.

Mirren won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in The Queen.

The King's Speech (2010)

While The King's Speech centers on Queen Elizabeth II's father, she is portrayed as a young child in the movie by actress Freya Wilson.

The story focusses on King George VI, played by Colin Firth, as he tries to overcome his speech impediment with the help of speech therapist Lionel Logue, played by Geoffrey Rush.

Walking the Dogs (2012)

This TV movie sees Emma Thompson play Queen Elizabeth II. Walking the Dogs features the infamous incident which saw Michael Fagan break into Buckingham Palace in 1982.

The intrusion, which is also portrayed in Season 4 of Netflix's The Crown, saw Fagan manage to break into the queen's bedroom.

The Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II (2012)

This documentary draws on rare archive footage, eyewitness accounts and historical experts to tell the behind-the-scenes story of the Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II.

The Coronation took place on June 2, 1953, at Westminster Abbey in London, following the death of Elizabeth II's father, George VI, in 1952. The queen was just 25 years old at the time of her crowning.

The Majestic Life of Queen Elizabeth II (2015)

This documentary film follows the incredible reign of Queen Elizabeth II and features rare archive footage.

The Crown (2016)

Hit Netflix drama The Crown has seen several actresses take on the role of Queen Elizabeth II. So far, Claire Foy and Olivia Colman have portrayed her at different stages of her life, with Imelda Staunton set to take over when the show returns for Season 5.

Previous seasons have followed the monarch through major events like her wedding to Prince Philip, her Coronation, the birth of her children, the rise of Margaret Thatcher, and many more.

The Royal House of Windsor (2017)

This six-episode Netflix docuseries explores the history of the royal family, taking viewers from World War I to the death of Princess Diana.

Elizabeth & Margaret: Love and Loyalty (2020)

Docuseries Elizabeth & Margaret: Love and Loyalty delves into the relationship between Queen Elizabeth II and her sister, Princess Margaret.

Princess Margaret passed away on February 9, 2002, aged 71, after suffering her fourth stroke.
